actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on June 9, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Arrington moved that the House do now adjourn.

Mr. Arrington asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, June 9, 2023, it adjourn to meet at noon on Monday, June 12, 2023, for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Arrington asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Wednesday, June 7, 2023, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 am on Friday, June 9, 2023. Agreed to without objection.

Mr. Arrington asked unanimous consent That, further consideration of the veto message of the President, to accompany H.J. Res. 45, is postponed until the legislative day of Wednesday, June 21, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
The Chair announced that the objections of the President to H.J. Res. 45 would be spread at large upon the Journal and the veto message would be printed as a House document (118-46).
The Chair laid before the House the veto message from the President.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Deputy Clerk transmitted to the House a sealed envelope received from the White House on June 7, 2023, at 5:58 p.m., said to contain a message from the President returning, without his approval, H.J. Res. 45.

actions-list.header: National Commission on the Future of the Navy
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 1092(b)(1)(A) of the James. M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for fiscal year 2023 (Public Law 117-263), and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed Mr. Scott O'Neill, Ridgecrest, California
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Joyce of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Cliff Bentz to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
